{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3325650,"name":"","username":"Farquaad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/farquaad/{size}/218709_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T15:57:45.948Z","cooked":"

Hello and thank you for reading. My team will use an Orange Pi 5 16gb with an Arducam ov9281 for PhotonVision. We seem to be good from a software side because there is a lot of documentation for getting the software running. Our main questions lie within how to properly wire the Orange Pi 5. We currently have It set to be powered with a micro USB cord that will get power from the VRM or PDP. Then we have the coprocessor connected through ethernet to an ethernet switch. Our biggest question is will the VRM or PDP supply the power needed to run the Orange Pi, or will we need an external power bank? Any help or suggestions are greatly appreciated, Thank you.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T15:57:45.948Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":813,"reads":252,"readers_count":251,"score":4110.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457553,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-5-photonvision-wiring-setup","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63302,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-5-photonvision-wiring-setup/457553/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3325662,"name":"Jack","username":"JR0405","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jr0405/{size}/179266_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T16:03:45.802Z","cooked":"

In short, no. You can’t use the PDP because orange pis take 5V, you shouldn’t use the VRM because they can pull more than 2A. You can use a battery bank (make sure it has enough current) or a DC-DC regulator (make sure it’s rated for 12V down to brown out voltage levels).

There’s been a couple different threads on the topic so the search bar is your friend here, I think this is the most popular thread: https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/powering-an-orange-pi-5/451958

Thank you for the response! I’ll definitely take a look at the other threads. I will also look into the DC regulators as they seem very helpful.

This is a pretty popular recommendation, and it works quite well

This might be a dumb question, but I am rather new to coprocessors and custom circuits. But does the Pololu Step-Down regulator attach directly to the orange pi? or does it take power from something like the VRM or power bank and convert it to 5V 5.5A?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T16:54:01.358Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":177,"readers_count":176,"score":120.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457553,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-5-photonvision-wiring-setup","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19820,"username":"ArchdukeTim","name":"Tim Winters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63302,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-5-photonvision-wiring-setup/457553/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3325789,"name":"Brett B Bonner","username":"bbonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T17:11:29.477Z","cooked":"

The regulator takes (unregulated) 12V from the PDP or PDH and outputs (regulated) 5V. That means the 5V stays constant as long as the input voltage stays above about 6V. (The difference is called “dropout voltage” and is about 1V on this regulator.)

The regulator is spec’d at 5.5A but at 5V output and 12V input, this regulator can source up to about 8A, enough to run 2 Pi’s (we did this on our 2023 robot).

Typical wiring for us is to have a 12V wire pair going into the regulator, with the output wired to the power pins of a USB-C connector that is plugged into the Pi.

If you use a power bank instead, that will itself output 5V, so you don’t need a regulator.

This makes a lot of sense! Thank you and everyone else for all the help! I think for now I will connect the Orange Pi to a power bank if we have one in our shops, but will most likely swap to a regulator in the future.
